result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL L WILLIAMS

defendant.name: WILLIAMS, MICHAEL L
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

3:52 PM Defendant MICHAEL L WILLIAMS in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for MICHAEL L WILLIAMS.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. The State has one witness. 

Jessica Liptow sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed as a probation agent with probation and parole. Identified the defendant present in court. Testimony given. Objection by Atty Nelson. Sustained. Cross by Atty Nelson. Objection by DA Laspisa. Court questions witness. Sustained. Testimony given. Court questions defendant. Cross continued by Atty Nelson. DA Laspisa objects. Court questions Atty Nelson. Atty Nelson withdraws question. Court questions witness. Re-direct by DA Laspisa. No re-cross.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court and states it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Nelson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading and confirms it mirrors the complaint. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return date January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM.


Court adjourned at 4:10 PM.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

10:13 AM Defendant MICHAEL L WILLIAMS in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for MICHAEL L WILLIAMS.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 10:14 AM

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing October 24, 2022 at 3:45 PM. 1/2  hour.
Initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Warrant cancelled / Spoke to Rhonda from dispatch

1:09 PM Defendant MICHAEL L WILLIAMS appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he's like to have an attorney present for this case. Court adjourns initial appearance so counsel may be present. Court quashes warrant. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Defendant makes statement regarding bond. Court sets bond at $5,000 Cash Bond. Court sets Initial Appearance for October 18, 2022 at 9:30 AM.

Court adjourned at: 1:12 PM
